greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of steps to reach an integer starting with (n+3)/4 and iterating the map x -> x*ceiling(x).
comment: Let S(n)=sum(k=1,n,a(k)) then it seems that S(n) is asymptotic to 2n. S(n)=2n for many values of n, namely n=10,128,198,199,237,238,241,242,246,247,249,267,329... More generally, starting with (n+2^m-1)/2^m and iterating the same map seems to produce the same kind of behavior for a(n) (i.e. sum(k=1,n,a(k)) is asymptotic to c(m)*n where c(m) depends on m and c(m) is a power of 2).
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 05 2002
